value.title: AI layoffs or ‘AI-washing’?
value.content: How many of the companies with recent layoffs are just using AI as an excuse?

value.title: Why Tether’s CEO is everywhere right now
value.content: For years, Tether's CEO avoided the United States, watching from offshore as regulators circled and prosecutors investigated. Those days are over.

value.title: Amazon’s ‘Melania’ documentary makes $7M on opening weekend
value.content: While the documentary is exceeding box office expectations, it's unlikely to make a profit in theaters.

value.title: Indonesia ‘conditionally’ lifts ban on Grok
value.content: Indonesia has followed Malaysia and the Philippines in lifting a ban on xAI’s chatbot Grok.

value.title: TechCrunch Mobility: The great Tesla rebranding
value.content: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility — your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation.

value.title: India offers zero taxes through 2047 to lure global AI workloads
value.content: New Delhi's latest move comes as Amazon, Google, and Microsoft expand data center investments in India.

value.title: Bye-bye corporate conglomerates. Hello personal conglomerates.
value.content: Elon Musk's reported merging of SpaceX, xAI, and Tesla harkens back to the heyday of General Electric — or maybe the robber barons of the Gilded Age.

value.title: Meet the new European unicorns of 2026
value.content: From Belgium to Ukraine, five fresh European unicorns were minted this January.

value.title: Waymo reportedly raising a $16B funding round
value.content: Waymo is reportedly finalizing a new funding round that will value the robotaxi company at $110 billion.

value.title: SpaceX seeks federal approval to launch 1 million solar-powered satellite data centers
value.content: SpaceX's filing claims these satellites will be “a first step towards becoming a Kardashev II-level civilization — one that can harness the Sun’s full power."

value.title: Nvidia CEO pushes back against report that his company’s $100B OpenAI investment has stalled
value.content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said that a recent report of friction between his company and OpenAI was “nonsense.”

value.title: HomeBoost’s app will show you where to save on your utility bills
value.content: The startup is partnering with utilities to help homeowners determine the best upgrades to cut their energy use.

value.title: a16z partner Kofi Ampadu to leave firm after TxO program pause
value.content: Ampadu's departure perhaps signals the end of the TxO chapter. The fund and program focused on supporting underserved founders by providing access to tech networks and investment capital through a donor-advised fund.

value.title: A peek inside Physical Intelligence, the startup building Silicon Valley’s buzziest robot brains
value.content: If co-founder Lachy Groom has any doubts, he doesn’t show it. He’s working with people who've been working on this problem for decades and who believe the timing is finally right, which is all he needs to know.

value.title: OnlyFans considering selling majority stake to Architect Capital
value.content: This isn't the first time in recent memory that OnlyFans has been in talks to sell off its business.

value.title: OpenClaw’s AI assistants are now building their own social network
value.content: The viral personal AI assistant formerly known as Clawdbot has a new shell — again. After briefly rebranding as Moltbot, it has now picked OpenClaw as its new name.

value.title: Informant told FBI that Jeffrey Epstein had a ‘personal hacker’
value.content: The hacker allegedly developed zero-day exploits and offensive cyber tools and sold them to several countries, including an unnamed central African government, the U.K., and the United States.

value.title: Instagram might soon let you remove yourself from someone’s Close Friends list
value.content: Since the feature's launch in 2018, users haven't been able to remove themselves from someone else's Close Friends list.

value.title: Blue Origin pauses space tourism flights to focus on the moon
value.content: The company is trying to take advantage of President Donald Trump's desire to return astronauts to the lunar surface by the end of his term.

value.title: SpaceX’s IPO could open the floodgates — and secondaries are booming in the meantime
value.content: To unpack what SpaceX’s IPO chatter means, how private liquidity works before a debut, and what investors are looking for in today’s pre-IPO giants, we spoke with Greg Martin, managing director at Rainmaker Securities, a broker-dealer specializing in secondary share transactions for late-stage private companies.
